block.p: The wines and foods of the Hudson Valley will be served at a tasting and auction on Sept. 16 from 1:30 to 5 p.m. at the Culinary Institute of America in Hyde Park, N.Y. The event will benefit Club Aspire, an organization that helps autistic children. Tickets are $55 in advance, $60 at the door: (845) 297-8800, extension 101.

Also on Sept. 16 in the Hudson Valley, there will be a tasting and dinner starting at 5:30 p.m. at Clinton Vineyards in Clinton Corners, N.Y., to support the Northeast Organic Farming Association of New York.

Among the chefs scheduled to cook are Gray Kunz, David Waltuck and Seen Lippert. For tickets, $65 to $250: (518) 827-8595

La Caravelle, 33 West 55th Street, will celebrate its 40th anniversary on Sept. 18 with a five-course black-tie dinner at 7:30 p.m. featuring the favorite dishes of some of its renowned customers, including Salvador Dali (foie gras), Malcolm Forbes (lobster and sole in an Americaine sauce) and Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis (Grand Marnier souffle). Tickets, $300, benefit City Harvest. Reservations: (212) 586-4252.

Not as venerable by half, but Daniel Boulud will celebrate his 20th anniversary as a chef in the United States with a black-tie dinner of 30 dishes at Daniel, 60 East 65th Street, on Sept. 25 at 7 p.m. Tickets, $500, will help send American chefs to cook in France: (212) 327-3434.

Correction: September 8, 2000, Friday A calendar listing in the Dining section on Wednesday about a wine tasting and dinner on Sept. 16 at Clinton Vineyards in Clinton Corners, N.Y., misstated the telephone number for tickets. It is (518) 827-8495.
